verses.verse: There is <S%H3426><s%> an evil <S%H7451><s%> which I have seen <S%H7200><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>, and it is heavy <S%H7227><s%> upon men <S%H120><s%>:

a man <S%H376><s%> to whom God <S%H430><s%> giveth <S%H5414><s%> riches <S%H6239><s%>, wealth <S%H6239><s%>, and honor <S%H3519><s%>, so that he lacketh <S%H2638><s%> nothing for his soul <S%H5315><s%> of all that he desireth <S%H183><s%>, yet God <S%H430><s%> giveth him not power <S%H7980><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%> thereof <S%H376><s%>, but an alien eateth <S%H398><s%> it <S%H1892><s%>; this is vanity, and it is an evil <S%H7451><s%> disease <S%H2483><s%>.

If a man <S%H376><s%> beget <S%H3205><s%> a hundred <S%H3967><s%> children <S%H2421><s%>, and live many <S%H7227><s%> years <S%H8141><s%>, so that the days <S%H3117><s%> of his years <S%H8141><s%> are many <S%H7227><s%>, but his soul <S%H5315><s%> be not filled <S%H7646><s%> with good <S%H2896><s%>, and moreover he have no burial <S%H6900><s%>; I say <S%H559><s%>, that an untimely birth <S%H5309><s%> is better than he <S%H2896><s%>:
for it cometh <S%H935><s%> in vanity <S%H1892><s%>, and departeth <S%H3212><s%> in darkness <S%H2822><s%>, and the name <S%H8034><s%> thereof is covered <S%H3680><s%> with darkness <S%H2822><s%>;
moreover it hath not seen <S%H7200><s%> the sun <S%H8121><s%> nor known <S%H3045><s%> it <S%H2088><s%>; this hath rest <S%H5183><s%> rather than the other <S%H2088><s%>:

yea <S%H432><s%>, though he live <S%H2421><s%> a thousand <S%H505><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> twice <S%H6471><s%> told <S%H7200><s%>, and yet enjoy no good <S%H2896><s%>, do not all go <S%H1980><s%> to one <S%H259><s%> place <S%H4725><s%>?
All the labor <S%H5999><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> is for his mouth <S%H6310><s%>, and yet the appetite <S%H5315><s%> is not filled <S%H4390><s%>.

For what advantage hath the wise <S%H2450><s%> more <S%H3148><s%> than the fool <S%H3684><s%>? or what hath the poor <S%H6041><s%> man <S%H3045><s%>, that knoweth how to walk <S%H1980><s%> before the living <S%H2416><s%>?

Better <S%H2896><s%> is the sight <S%H4758><s%> of the eyes <S%H5869><s%> than the wandering <S%H1980><s%> of the desire <S%H5315><s%>: this also is vanity <S%H1892><s%> and a striving <S%H7469><s%> after wind <S%H7307><s%>.

Whatsoever hath been <S%H7121><s%>, the name thereof was given long ago <S%H3528><s%>; and it is known <S%H3045><s%> what man <S%H120><s%> is <S%H3201><s%>; neither can he contend <S%H1777><s%> with him that is mightier than he <S%H8623><s%>.
Seeing there are <S%H3426><s%> many <S%H7235><s%> things <S%H1697><s%> that increase <S%H7235><s%> vanity <S%H1892><s%>, what is man <S%H120><s%> the better <S%H3148><s%>?

For who knoweth <S%H3045><s%> what is good <S%H2896><s%> for man <S%H120><s%> in his life <S%H2416><s%>, all <S%H4557><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of his vain <S%H1892><s%> life <S%H2416><s%> which he spendeth <S%H6213><s%> as a shadow <S%H6738><s%>? for who can tell <S%H5046><s%> a man <S%H120><s%> what shall be after <S%H310><s%> him under the sun <S%H8121><s%>?
